item.title: Closed
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Jayden Lord Jayden
item.description:
@Lord_Jayden wrote:

Anyways, how do I remove the skull? And just say I want to put it back, how would I do so??[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 05, 2007, 11:01:54 PM[/size][hr]You know what… Fuck this… It’ll probly end up screwing up my server, and I dont want that Ill just keep the Skull, its good. And forget the stupid Server Name and the Owner… Lmao, People can easily figure that out by typing ::help - Or by looking at practically EVERYTHING that says ‘FrostScape’ Thanks for you help though.

item.title: Closed
item.dc:creator: @SmokeSome SmokeSome
item.description:
@SmokeSome wrote:

ok umm… Go in client.java, Search “Public void” and you’ll see something like…

Public void something() {

go ABOVE that, you’ll probably see a “}” which is the end of another code. go below that, and add your void.

then go to the boolean process. this is what mine looks like.

ublic boolean process() { // is being called regularily every 500ms if (actionAmount < 0) { actionAmount = 0; } if (actionTimer > 0) { actionTimer -= 1; } if (actionAmount > 25) { sendMessage("Kicked for acting too fast!");
Now to add the writePlayers(); i will change it to this.

ublic boolean process() { // is being called regularily every 500ms writePlayers1(); if (actionAmount < 0) { actionAmount = 0; } if (actionTimer > 0) { actionTimer -= 1; } if (actionAmount > 25) { sendMessage("Kicked for acting too fast!");[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 05, 2007, 10:24:56 PM[/size][hr]ok, if you would have explained that was your problem then i could have helped you more, but you act like it’s my fault you gave less information that you should have.

If it flicks on and off, it means you have something else on your screen. such as a skull saying something? you can only have one thing at a time, and must pick which you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Closed
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Jayden Lord Jayden
item.description:
@Lord_Jayden wrote:

Can you tell me where abouts I add that? Like, what do I search for in Cntrl+F in my Client.Java file, AND - Where do I put it? Under, or Over the searched Text?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 05, 2007, 10:09:07 PM[/size][hr]I’m really sorry, and ANGRY THAT THIS WONT FRICKING WORK… But when I did your instructions, I added the Void thingy just somewhere randomly in my Client.Java - And then searched for ‘Boolean Process’ and Pressed enter to make a new line. Then on the new line I wrote ‘writePlayers1();’ and compiled, and got 100 errors… PLEASE Tell me in a detailed post what I have to do to get a working Server Name, PlayerCount and Server Owner thing…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 05, 2007, 10:14:20 PM[/size][hr]Okay, heres a DETAILED Explanation of what is happening so far… I’ve added:

//Playercount and server name at top of screen
public void writePlayers() {
int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount();
sendFrame126("@whi@~@gre@Frost-Scape.@dbl@~", 6571);
sendFrame126("@cya@Owner: Shukumeii", 6572);
sendFrame126(" @dbl@Players On - " + players, 6664);
setInterfaceWalkable(6673);//6673
}

In my Client.Java folder, just somewhere randomly… And then, After searching ‘Boolean Process’ I press enter to create a new line, and then on that new line I wrote ‘writePlayers();’
I then compiled, and rebooted ~ And now when I log in, every now and then my PK Skull down the bottom where it says ‘Safe’ or ‘Wilderness’ Dissapears, and then I see the PlayerCount and Server Name up the top, for like… A SPLIT Second. :\ The PlayerCount and Server Name just keeps flashing on and off… PLEASE HELP???

Read full topic

item.title: Closed
item.dc:creator: @SmokeSome SmokeSome
item.description:
@SmokeSome wrote:

Sorry if it isn’t detailed enough. This isn’t at the top of the screen, it’s at the top left.

Add this void -

public void writePlayers1() { int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount(); sendFrame126("", 13589); sendFrame126("", 13590); sendFrame126("@whi@[server name]", 13591); sendFrame126("@whi@[server owner]", 13592); sendFrame126("@gre@Players Online: " +players, 13593); sendFrame126("", 13594); sendFrame126("", 13595); sendFrame126("", 13596); sendFrame126("", 13597); sendFrame126("", 13598); sendFrame126("", 13599); sendFrame126("", 13600); setInterfaceWalkable(13588); }
the other Frames are for adding other things. Such as co owners, etc.

Then search Boolean Process You’ll see something like…

public boolean process() { // is being called regularily every 500ms

Under that, add this -

writePlayers1();

item.title: Closed
item.dc:creator: @Coldbloodio Coldbloodio
item.description:
@Coldbloodio wrote:

search for something in the code below to see if you find anything. Add what you want

[code]long current = System.currentTimeMillis();
if (inCombat && current-lastCombat >= 7500) {
inCombat = false;
}

barTimer++;
if (barTimer >= 100) {
  if (matchId > -1) {
    sendFrame126("Pk:  "+handler.matches[matchId].getStatus(this), 6570);

  } else {
    for (int i = 0; i < server.playerHandler.players.length; i++) {
      client p = (client)server.playerHandler.players[i];
      if (p != null &&  ! p.disconnected && p.combatLevel >= 3) {
        p.sendFrame126("YOUR SERVER NAME HERE ("+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+" online)", 6570);
      }
    }
    replaceDoors();
  }

  barTimer = 0;
}
saveTimer++;
if (saveTimer >= 300) {
  savegame(false);
  //sendMessage("Your profile has been automatically saved");
  saveTimer = 0;
}[/code]

Read full topic
